title: NASA Holds Ribbon Cutting for New Earth Information Center
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson led a ribbon cutting ceremony Wednesday to showcase a new Earth Information Center at NASA Headquarters in Washington. The center is part physical space and part virtual experience, which shows how NASA data can improve lives in the face of disasters, environmental challenges, and our changing world.

title: Scout Space announces new investors
summary: Scout Space, a startup developing technologies for space situational awareness, announced June 20 it has secured undisclosed funding from the venture capital firm Decisive Point and from government contractor Noblis.

title: Startup Danti unveils search engine for geospatial data
summary: A new startup, Danti, came out of stealth June 21 with a search engine designed for users of geospatial data.

title: Op-ed | The Space Race may already be won
summary: Justin Fauntleroy is a government contractor responsible for writing future concepts and doctrine for the U.S. military, specifically the Joint Staff and Naval Warfare Development Center. He earned a bachelor’s […]

title: Space Forge names manager for U.S. manufacturing operations
summary: Space Forge will flesh out its U.S. strategy with the help of Andrew Parlock, the U.K.-based startup’s new managing director for U.S. manufacturing operations.

title: FAA reduces airspace restrictions for Cape Canaveral launches
summary: The FAA has started to reduce the amount of airspace it closes for launches from Cape Canaveral as part of efforts to limit the impact of growing launch activity on commercial aviation.

title: Indian SSA startup raises $10 million
summary: An Indian startup has raised $10 million to start development of commercial space situational awareness (SSA) capabilities that will include data from spacecraft.

title: Vyoma raises $9 million for debris-monitoring satellites
summary: German startup Vyoma said June 20 it has raised 8.5 million euros ($9.3 million) to develop space debris-monitoring satellites from investors that include French aerospace giant Safran, which will help develop the constellation.

title: RFA Sign Binding Term Sheet for Access to Guiana Space Center
summary:
German launch startup Rocket Factory Augsburg has signed a binding term sheet with French space agency CNES to access a new commercial launch facility being built on the grounds of the old Diamant launch complex at the Guiana Space Center in French Guiana. The company will utilize the facility to launch its RFA ONE vehicle […]
The post RFA Sign Binding Term Sheet for Access to Guiana Space Center appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: United Launch Alliance ready for penultimate Delta IV Heavy launch
summary: United Launch Alliance is targeting the launch of the penultimate Delta IV Heavy with the secretive NROL-68 mission at 3:29 AM ET...
